posts.post_content:
Falls to Lightning Bo-  
Doom Bla-  
Journey to Nowh-  
Pyrocla-  
Arre-  
Conde-

Well heck. It's like WotC looked through comments pages and got sick of seeing all the "falls to" comments. But seriously, this thing is some sort of amazing in Infect decks and even outside of those it remains a great black creature.

Posted By: bri_boomer (1/30/2011 12:56:29 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Doesn't die to most of the "usual" removal, true, but there are plenty of ways to deal with it.  
  
White has [Day of Judgment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgment) and [Dispense Justice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dispense Justice).  
Red is mostly out of options unless they grab some artifact support. Pyroclasm does not kill this, since protection prevents damage among other things. The best answer mono-red can do is [Leyline of Punishment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Punishment) combined with non-targeting damage from something like [Pyroclasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyroclasm), [Slagstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Slagstorm), or [Chain Reaction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chain Reaction).  
Blue has its full range of lockdown/control change options available.  
Green has [Hornet Sting](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hornet Sting) if you have two, but otherwise needs support effects like [Liquimetal Coating](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liquimetal Coating) or [Flight Spellbomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flight Spellbomb) to be able to use removal spells on it. Or it can do what green does best and force it into combat with a fatty.  
Black has *lots* of options if you ignore Doom Blade ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Doesn't die to most of the "usual" removal, true, but there are plenty of ways to deal with it.

White has Day of Judgment and Dispense Justice.
Red is mostly out of options unless they grab some artifact support. Pyroclasm does not kill this, since protection prevents damage among other things. The best answer mono-red can do is Leyline of Punishment combined with non-targeting damage from something like Pyroclasm, Slagstorm, or Chain Reaction.
Blue has its full range of lockdown/control change options available.
Green has Hornet Sting if you have two, but otherwise needs support effects like Liquimetal Coating or Flight Spellbomb to be able to use removal spells on it. Or it can do what green does best and force it into combat with a fatty.
Black has lots of options if you ignore Doom Blade ... (see all)
